# How to Update Your Mercedes Benz Navigation System with DVD Comand APS NTG1
 
If you have a Mercedes Benz with an older navigation system, you might be interested in updating it with the latest DVD Comand APS NTG1. This DVD contains the most recent maps and points of interest for Europe, covering more than 9.2 million kilometers of road network. It also includes new features and bug fixes for your COMAND system.
 
In this article, we will show you how to download and install the DVD Comand APS NTG1 on your Mercedes Benz. You will need a blank CD-R, a computer with a DVD burner, and a torrent client.

## Step 1: Download the DVD Comand APS NTG1 Torrent File
 
The first step is to download the torrent file for the DVD Comand APS NTG1. You can find it on various websites, such as [^1^] or [^3^]. Make sure you download the correct version for your COMAND system. The version we are using is V14.0, disc number A211 827 4565, color green.
 
Once you have downloaded the torrent file, open it with your torrent client and start downloading the ISO image of the DVD. This might take some time depending on your internet speed and the number of seeders.
 
## Step 2: Burn the ISO Image to a CD-R
 
When the download is complete, you will have an ISO image file of the DVD Comand APS NTG1 on your computer. You need to burn this file to a blank CD-R using a DVD burner software. Do not use a DVD-R or a DVD+R, as they will not work with your COMAND system.
 
You can use any DVD burner software that supports ISO image files, such as Nero, ImgBurn, or CDBurnerXP. Follow the instructions of your software to burn the ISO image to a CD-R at the lowest possible speed. Label the CD-R as "COMAND Update".

## Step 3: Install the CD-R into Your COMAND System
 
Now you are ready to install the CD-R into your COMAND system. Make sure your car is parked and the engine is running. Turn on your COMAND system and eject any disc that might be inside. Insert the CD-R labeled "COMAND Update" into the slot.
 
The COMAND system will recognize the CD-R and start updating automatically. You will see a progress bar on the screen and hear some beeps. Do not turn off your COMAND system or eject the CD-R during this process. It might take up to 30 minutes for the update to complete.
 
When the update is finished, you will see a message on the screen saying "Update successful". The COMAND system will restart and eject the CD-R. You can now remove the CD-R and store it in a safe place.
 
## Step 4: Enjoy Your Updated Navigation System
 
Congratulations! You have successfully updated your navigation system with the DVD Comand APS NTG1. You can now enjoy the latest maps and points of interest for Europe on your COMAND screen. You can also use newer navigation DVDs that are compatible with your updated system.
 
To check if your update was successful, you can access the engineering menu of your COMAND system by pressing MUTE+END+SERV or SERV -> Lang -> Back ->END+\"upper-left arrow\"+AUDIO (depending on your model). You should see the version number of your COMAND firmware on the screen.
 
We hope this article was helpful and informative. If you have any questions or problems, please contact us or visit our forum for more tips and tricks.
